To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service currently located at 16281 U.S.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

header.#text: Anna Stepanovna Politkovskaya Memorial Post Office

text.#text:
Anna Stepanovna Politkovskaya, an American citizen of Russian extraction, was a Russian-American
			 journalist who exposed numerous human rights violations committed by the
			 Russian military in Chechnya, and was a harsh critic of Vladimir Putin.

In 2001, while investigating complaints of torture in the Chechen town of Khattuni, she was
			 detained and beaten by Russian military officials.

In 2004, she published the book Putin’s Russia, which exposed many harsh police state tactics of
			 the Putin regime.
In September 2004, she became severely ill after an assassination attempt using poisoned tea.
In 2006, she was shot to death in her apartment in Moscow, Russia.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
currently located at 16281 U.S. Highway 59 in
			 Moscow, Texas, shall hereafter be known as the

text.#text:

			 reference to the
